WorkItem.Description:
I experience a strange situation: 
 1) environment on unix with a old PHP installation (version: 5.1.2) and none of the extensions mentioned as prerequisites, where PHPExcel works well (I can run examples and my code too, to generate/download xls files $excel_version='Excel5')
 2) similar environment on unix with recent PHP installation (version: 5.4.17) with xml extension loaded (still no gd or g2 extension) where PHPExcel does NOT work (it seems to get stuck when instantiating PHPExcel object:$objPHPExcel = new PHPExcel(); )

Please clarify the following regarding PHPExcel prerequisites:
1. is gd extension indeed needed? If yes, how does it work in environment #1 without gd extension ? Please provide a link from where I could download this extension for unix and how to install it.
2. is there some other prerequisite that is not mentioned?
3. is PHP version 5.2 or later a must or it is just recommended? in my environment #1 it works under 5.1.2. 
4. how could I find out what is not properly installed on environment #2? please advise what can I do to fix it.

Please refer to the details below regarding loaded extensions (info displayed using functions get loaded_extensions and extension_loaded). 

Environment #1 --> PHPExcel works:

loaded extensions:
